result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Scott M Kontowicz was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Scott M Kontowicz was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: Fine is to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

DNA surcharge and Blood draw costs are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha County Sheriff's Department.  Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision and may be taken out of prison wages or trust accounts.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

No violent contact with any family member or victim listed in this case or case 14CM2243.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.
Cases 15CF1011 and 16CF935 were dismissed and read in.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Grant Scaife and ADA Bryan Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Scott M Kontowicz in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin.    

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to counts 2 & 7.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of counts 2 & 7.
Count 1 is dismissed out right.
Counts 3, 4, 5 & 6 are dismissed as read ins.
Count 8 is dismissed by operation  law.
Defendant's mother presented a statement to the court.
Defendant's aunt presented a statement to the court.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.




Court orders the following:
Count 2:
90 Days in the Waukesha County Jail.
151 Days Credit.
Concurrent to:  case 14CM2243
TIME SERVED.

Costs:  $243
CV Surcharge:  $100
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  Court Waives.
Apply Bail and refund the balance to the posting party.


  



Count 7:
Total Prison:  54 MONTHS.
Initial Confinement:  18 MONTHS.
Extended Supervision:  3 YEARS.

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

36  Months D/L REVOCATION
36  Months IGNITION INTERLOCK

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No violent contact with:  any family member or victim listed in this case or case 14CM2243.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.


FINE:  $2,023
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to Waukesha County Sheriff's Department. 
To be paid as a Condition of the Sentence (can be taken out of prison wages or trust accounts).

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  



Defendant to be transferred to DCI - FORTHWITH.
